solution_line_template: She made {total_bracelets_made} bracelets but gave {bracelets_given_away} away so she had {total_bracelets_made}-{bracelets_given_away} = <<{total_bracelets_made}-{bracelets_given_away}={bracelets_remaining}>>{bracelets_remaining} bracelets left.

She sold {bracelets_remaining} bracelets at ${price_per_bracelet} each for a total of {bracelets_remaining} * {price_per_bracelet} = $<<{bracelets_remaining}*{price_per_bracelet}={total_sales_revenue}>>{total_sales_revenue}

She made ${total_sales_revenue} but she spent ${material_cost} on the supplies. So her profit would be {total_sales_revenue}-{material_cost} = $<<{total_sales_revenue}-{material_cost}={profit}>>{profit}
